channel.title: It it safe to use an auto talker?
channel.description:
I was just wondering if it is safe to use an auto talker at the moment?
Anyone who answers <3
:P

item.title: It it safe to use an auto talker?
item.dc:creator: @Surajd Surajd
item.description:
@Surajd wrote:

It’s only safe to use an AutoTalker, if it uses random waiting times and there are no Mods around.

Read full topic
item.source: It it safe to use an auto talker?

item.title: It it safe to use an auto talker?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote="!!1one!eleven1!, post:14, topic:3771"]I think auto talkers are safe, My mod friend said in the player mod forum it says not to mute or report auto talkers. I think its because autotalkers are used with people that have RSI.[/quote]But by that reasoning, since every aspect of runescape is repetitive to the point of exhaustion, whats wrong with botting :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: It it safe to use an auto talker?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Just press CNTRL+ALT+P to pause the script, and them stop it manually.

Autotalkers are pretty simple to make, learn SCAR, it should be no problem.

Also, I heard something a couple of weeks ago, that spamming the chat box is no longer reportable by Pmods (Aka, you are not going to get banned,) not sure if it is true though.

Autotalking shouldn’t get you banned.

Read full topic
item.source: It it safe to use an auto talker?

item.title: It it safe to use an auto talker?

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Dude that sucks. Whenever you try and stop it it doesn’t stop so I get reported about 10 times and when I try and X out it wont and when I bring up Ctrl+alt+delete it minimizes itself so I can’t stop the App. Keylogged?
